title: Liverpool defender Dejan Lovren has flown to Germany for treatment on recurring knee injury
text:
Croktober fest Liverpool defender Dejan Lovren has flown to Germany for treatment on recurring knee injury 
Croatian has missed out the Reds' last two games due to the injury after it flared up again against Chelsea By PHIL THOMAS Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments DEJAN LOVREN has flown to Germany for treatment on his troublesome knee problem in a bid to get back to action. 
The Liverpool centre back has missed the last two games after the problem flared up again following the draw with Chelsea. Reuters 5 Dejan Lovren’s knee injury flared up in the draw to Chelsea 
Now the Reds have sent him to see renowned German national team doctor Hans-Wilhelm Muller-Wohlfahrt, who has previously treated the likes of Steven Gerrard , Usain Bolt and Paula Radcliffe.

Lovren stayed at Melwood while the rest of Liverpool’s first team headed to a warm weather training camp at La Manga last week. 
They returned on Sunday – when the Croatian centre back, 27, was jetting off to Munich. 
Initial fears that he had damaged ligaments were cleared by a scan, but Jurgen Klopp wants to solve the problem once and for all. Lovren has established himself as the Kop boss’s first choice centre back partner for Joel Matip, ahead of Ragnar Klavan and Lucas Leiva. 
The former Southampton defender has featured 23 times for the Reds this season has also chipped in with two Premier League goals. 
He netted in the winning goal in their 2-1 win over Chelsea back in September before scoring in a 4-2 win away to Crystal Palace in October.
